elements.title: Asakusa Culture Tourist Information Center (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the architect of the Asakusa Culture Tourist Information Center (pictured) thought of stacked nagaya houses while designing it?

elements.title: 2023 AFL Women's season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after going winless in its first season in 2022, Sydney made the finals in the 2023 AFL Women's season and won its first finals match?

elements.title: Rasmus Paludan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rasmus Paludan caused a global controversy by burning the Quran?

elements.title: Canadian Dental Care Plan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than one million applications for the Canadian Dental Care Plan were approved in its first three months?

elements.title: Wyll Stanway (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that footballer Wyll Stanway was a National Counties cricketer and a football centre-back before becoming a goalkeeper?

elements.title: president of Centre College (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that James McChord is considered to be the first president of Centre College despite dying before officially taking up the role?

elements.title: Entre el Mar y una Estrella (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Entre el Mar y una Estrella" by Thalía was crowned the best number-one Latin hit of the last 20 years in a survey conducted by Billboard?

elements.title: Geoffrey Cuming (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Geoffrey Cuming edited what has been called a gramophone librarian's "Bible"?

elements.title: a 2000 documentary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 2000 documentary exposed the secret support of female genital mutilation by Norwegian imams?
